Compensation:
Child and Adolscent Labour Rehabilitation Fund


Compensation and Backwages for Child/Adolescent Labour
Eligibility:
Such a fund shall be constituted in every district or for two or more districts by the appropriate Government (Lt Governor) to which:

(i) fine (Section 14: atleast Rs. 20,000/- and may extend to Rs. 50,000/-) realised from the employer of the child and adolescent shall be credited
(ii) Rs 15,000/- shall be credited to the Fund for each child or adolescent by the appropriate Government (Lt Governor)

The amount credited in (i) and (ii) shall be deposited in banks or invested as the appropriate Government may decide. This deposited or invested amount along with the interest shall be paid to the child or adolescenet in whose favour such amount is credited in such manner as may be prescribed.
Legislation/Policy/SOP: Section 14B of the Child and Adolescent Labour (Prohibition and Regulation) Act, 1986
Documents required:
- Noting from the Labour department who led the rescue
 OR
- Order of the CWC (production, noting about child rescued from the child labor etc.) 
 OR 
- Copy of the FIR mentioning sections booked under the Child and Adolescent Labour (Prohibition and Regulation) Act, 1986

Compensation: Central Sector Scheme for Rehabilitation of Bonded Labour
Eligibility:
1. The rehabilitation assistance shall be Rs 1,00,000/- per adult male beneficiary. The beneficiary shall have the option to either deposit is in an annuity scheme or receive cash grant. The District Administration will assess the cash requirement of the beneficiary and put the money under the annuity scheme with the consent of the beneficiary.

2. For beneficiaries such as children and women, the amount of rehabilitation assistance shall be Rs 2,00,000/- of which atleast Rs 1,25,000/- shall be deposited in an annuity scheme in the name of each beneficiary and the balance shall be transferred to the beneficiary account through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

3. In cases of bonded or forced labour involving extreme cases of deprivation or marginilisation such as transgenders, women or children rescued from sexual exploitation oe in cases of differently abled persons or where the District Magistrate deems fit, the rehabilitation assiatnce shall be Rs 3,00,000/- of which Rs 2,00,000/- shall be deposited in an annuity scheme in the name of each beneficiary and Rs 1,00,000/- shall be transferred to the beenficiary account through DBT. 

4. Immediate financial assistance upto Rs 30,000/- shall be provided by the District Administration to the rescued person out of the District Bonded Labour Rehabilitation Fund at the disposal of the District Magistate. In the District Magistrate is satisfied that a rescued person requires more than Rs 30,000/-, they may disburse such higher amount as deemed fit but limited to the maximum entitlement prescribed under this scheme. This shall be deducted from the rehabilitation assistance amount.

Legislation/Policy/SOP: Central Sector Scheme for Rehabilitation of Bonded Labour 2021, Ministry of Labour and Employment, Government of India
Documents required:
- Release Certificate of the rescued child who is released from the bonded labor.
OR
- Conviction order (either through a Summary Trial or Regular Trial for the full and final compensation)

Eligibility:
The primary objective of the Delhi Victims Compensation Scheme, 2015 is to provide funds for the purpose of compensation to the victims or their dependents who have suffered loss or injury as a result of the crime and who require rehabilitation. Under the scheme, the list of offences and minimum & maximum compensation amount is available at Delhi victims compensation scheme 2018.pdf 

Interim relief of a maximum of Rs 50,000/- shall be granted except in cases of extreme hardship and gravity of the offence. 

The Scheme also stipulates that a victim who has been paid interim compensation under this scheme will have to refund the amount paid, if the trial court directs the convicted accused to pay compensation to them at the end of the trial.

'Victim' refers to a person who has suffered loss or injury as a result of the offence AND in case of death, 'victim' includes their guardians and heirs.
Legislation/Policy/SOP:
Delhi Victims Compensation Scheme, 2016 

VICTIM COMPENSATION SECTION | Delhi State Legal Services Authority
Documents required:
1. An application (Form I Delhi victims compensation scheme 2018.pdf ) for the compensation may be applied by:
a) the victim or
b) dependents or
c) SHO of the area

2. Copy of FIR
3. Medical Report
4. Death Certificate (if available)
5. Copy of judgment/order if trial is over

The application and the documents shall be submitted to the State or the concerned District Legal Services Authority.

Eligibility: Special relief is to be provided for contingencies such as food, clothes, transport and other essential needs.
